title: Belize wins two top honours at 22nd annual World Travel AwardsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Belize wins two top honours at 22nd annual World Travel Awards Published on : Thursday, October 15, 2015
Firmly establishing itself as one of the world’s most desirable travel destinations, Belize won two top honours at the 22nd annual World Travel Awards. Ambergris Caye off Belize’s Great Barrier Reef was awarded “Mexico & Central America’s Leading Destination” while Placencia was recognised as “Mexico & Central America’s Leading Beach Destination” at the 2015 international awards ceremony, held this year in Bogota, Colombia.
The award was accepted by Vice Chairman of the Belize Tourism Board’s Board of Directors, Einer Gomez, on behalf of BTB.
Gomez thanked the people of Belize, “and all the stakeholders, who commit themselves day-in-and-day-out to providing quality customer service, and for welcoming travelers into our country with open arms.”
The Lodge at Chaa Creek, one of Belize’s first eco-resorts, said the country is proud to receive the award.
Chaa Creek co-owner and GM Lucy Fleming said, “This was first time in the twenty-two years of the awards that Belize made the winner’s list, and to take two of the region’s most important ‘Travel Oscars’ is a significant achievement that the entire country can be proud of.”
The Lodge at Chaa Creek is a multi award winning eco resort set within a 365-acre private nature reserve along the banks of the Macal River in Belize.
The World Travel Awards is regarded as the ‘Travel Oscars’ and was established in 1993.
